definition: long-term resident/permanent residence/eternalism (permanence of soul, Sanskrit śāśvata-vāda)
always/ever/often/frequently/common/general/constant
surname Chang
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
eternalism (permanence of soul, Sanskrit śāśvata-vāda)

sentences.english: Are classified, in general, with the permanent population.
sentences.chinese: 一般是按常住人口划分的。

sentences.english: We must perpetuate the Proper Dharma.
sentences.chinese: 一定要令正法常住于世。

sentences.english: How does a Taoist monastery organize itself internally?
sentences.chinese: 十方丛林中的常住道士如何分工？

sentences.english: He used to live in Iowa.
sentences.chinese: 他过去常住在依阿华州。

sentences.english: He used to live in a cottage near the river.
sentences.chinese: 他常住在河边的一座小木房里。

sentences.english: The enforcement of the ruling shall be assisted by his work unit and the local police station.
sentences.chinese: 单位和常住地公安派出所应当协助执行裁决。

sentences.english: Shanghai has a residential population of over 16 million.
sentences.chinese: 上海常住人口有一千六百多万。

sentences.english: Khenpo Ramesh was also the resident teacher of the famous Nyingmapa Monastery in Saranath for 3 years.
sentences.chinese: 堪布也曾在著名宁玛巴寺院当了三年的常住导师。

sentences.english: Indwells this fragile jar of clay.

stable household, established profession (idiom); settled and comfortably off
